summary: This is the last will and testament of Jeffrey E. Epstein, in which he appoints executors, directs the payment of debts and taxes, and bequeaths his entire estate to the trustees of the 'JEFFREY E. EPSTEIN 2017 TRUST'. It outlines executor compensation and succession plans.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: The individual creating the will, directing the disposition of his estate upon his death.

persons.context: Named as one of the primary executors of Epstein's will.

persons.name: Stephen Hanson
persons.context: Named as the third successor executor if a primary executor cannot serve.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's will directs his entire estate to be transferred to the trustees of the 'JEFFREY E. EPSTEIN 2017 TRUST'.
Epstein appointed Darren K. Indyke, Richard D. Kahn, and Terje R' '-Larsen as the primary executors of his will.
The will establishes a clear line of succession for executors: Eva Andersson D In, followed by Kathryn Ruemmler, followed by Stephen Hanson.
Each executor is to be compensated with $250,000 for their services, with no additional compensation permitted.
Epstein declared his residence and domicile as St. Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands.
